Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First lets look at the structure of the event logs Both logs have columns for CaseID Activity Timestamp LocalResident CommunityGroup PreliminaryScore ScoreAdjustment Decision and Resource For Group A Protected Group All entries have LocalResident set to FALSE CommunityGroup is always None PreliminaryScore is given and ScoreAdjustment is 0 for all cases Decisions are either Approved or Rejected based on the PreliminaryScore For Group B Unprotected Group All entries have LocalResident set to TRUE CommunityGroup is sometimes Highland Civic Darts Club and sometimes None PreliminaryScore is given but theres a ScoreAdjustment in some cases +10 for Community Boost Decisions are either Approved or Rejected based on the adjusted score

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now lets look at the specific cases Group A Protected Group 1 Case P001 PreliminaryScore is 720 no adjustment approved 2 Case P002 PreliminaryScore is 710 no adjustment rejected 3 Case P003 PreliminaryScore is 740 no adjustment approved Group B Unprotected Group 1 Case U001 PreliminaryScore is 720 adjustment of +10 Community Boost final score 730 approved 2 Case U002 PreliminaryScore is 710 no adjustment rejected 3 Case U003 PreliminaryScore is 695 adjustment of +10 Community Boost final score 705 approved

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now lets compare the decisions For Group A the threshold seems to be around 720 Scores above 720 are approved and below are rejected For Group B the threshold is also around 720 but with adjustments For example U001 had a score of 720 but got a +10 adjustment making it 730 which was approved U003 had a score of 695 got a +10 adjustment making it 705 which was approved U002 had a score of 710 with no adjustment and was rejected

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The key difference is the ScoreAdjustment column In Group B if the applicant is part of the Highland Civic Darts Club they get a +10 boost to their score This adjustment is not present in Group A

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - PE
Text: Without the boost U001 would have been 720 same as P001 in Group A which was approved without any boost U003 would have been 695 which is below the threshold seen in Group A so it would likely have been rejected But with the boost U003 was approved with a score of 705 which is still below the lowest approved score in Group A 720 for P001

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: In Group A 2 out of 3 cases are approved P001 and P003 and 1 is rejected P002 In Group B 2 out of 3 cases are approved U001 and U003 and 1 is rejected U002 At first glance the approval rates are the same 23 in both groups

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: This suggests that Group B is being given preferential treatment through the score adjustment based on CommunityGroup which is not available to Group A Therefore the bias is exhibited in the Group B log because it shows that members of Group B can receive score adjustments based on CommunityGroup leading to approvals that might not have occurred without the adjustment This treatment is not available to Group A indicating bias against Group A the protected group

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: But wait in Group A P002 had a score of 710 and was rejected similar to U002 in Group B However U001 and U003 got adjustments that pushed their scores higher But to be thorough lets see if theres bias in Group As log In Group A all applicants are treated the same way no adjustments decisions based solely on PreliminaryScore So Group As log doesnt exhibit bias in itself its the comparison with Group B that shows the bias
